events.message: Customer reported a car accident that occurred at an intersection resulting in front bumper damage.
The claim was classified under Auto Accident after reviewing initial accident details and damage description.
An experienced claims agent specialized in vehicle collisions was assigned to manage this case with priority.
Acknowledgment was sent to the customer confirming receipt of the auto accident claim and next steps.
Customer was requested to submit photos of the damaged car, police report, and a repair estimate from a certified garage.
Customer provided all requested documents including photos, police report, and a verified mechanic’s damage assessment.
Claims adjuster began investigation to validate incident details, review submitted evidence, and determine claim legitimacy.
Investigation confirmed the collision occurred as reported and damage assessment matched submitted documentation.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover the repair costs plus a rental car for the inconvenience during repairs.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the timely processing and the proposed settlement terms offered.
The claim was formally approved by the underwriting team following customer acceptance of the settlement agreement.
Payment for approved repair costs and rental coverage was issued promptly to the customer’s designated bank account.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after confirming the customer’s vehicle repairs were completed satisfactorily.
All claim documents and records were archived securely in compliance with data retention policies for future reference.
